page.title: 04WILTSHIRE WILDLIFE
page.content: Wildlife is very much in evidence, and up to sixty different species of bird are known to breed regularly in this area. They include: Rooks, Doves, Wood Pigeons, Cuckoos, Robins, Finches, Tits, Wagtails, Sparrow Hawks, Wrens, Kestrels and Lapwings. Game birds such as Partridge and Pheasants (including a strain of White Pheasant) are seen wandering about the fields and copses. Roe-deer are now well established on the Plain and two were seen on our visit to Normanton Gorse. A large community of rabbits was seen near one of the Long Barrows, with signs of stoats and weazles too. Foxes and vixen can be heard at night as they search for food. Field mice, voles and shrews are much sought after by Kestrels and Owls and can be seen regularly hovering over the fields and grass verges in search of food.
